content: african spirit flamingos african spirit flamingos sarah athey designs thanks for downloading my flamingos i designed this flamingo pattern while creating african spirit but decided not to use it but with you all loving the extra sections i decided to get it on the computer for you all african spirit flamingos has the same stitch count as my african spirit pattern and all the same us overlay mosaic crochet terms at the start and finish of every row will be a single_crochet stitch these are separate to the pattern and you will go through both loops of these stitches at either end i call these anchor stitches as every single crochet is written as s and every double_crochet is written as d i hope that you find it as easy as i do this pattern is in us terms using overlay mosaic crochet in one size you cut the yarn and alternate the colours with each row 1 repeat chain 60 2 repeats chain 116 3 repeats chain 172 4 repeats chain 228 the chart is read from bottom to top and right to left so you start at the bottom right of the chart each blank square is a single_crochet and each square with an x is a double_crochet i have a pdf in my facebook group files on how to read overlay mosaic crochet charts here https //www facebook com/groups/809381026680096/ the blue column on the chart is the very last stitch of the row you only do this stitch after you have finished the needed number of repeats hook and flow sarah athey designs 2023© african spirit flamingos glossary/abbreviations chain= chain stitches create a slip knot by wrapping the yarn in a circle hold it together with your fingers with the other hand pull a loop of yarn from the main ball and pull it through creating a knot creating a chain with your hook in the knot wrap your hook around the long end of the yarn and pull it through repeat this as many times as needed for the required amount of chain stitches 7s= 7x single_crochet insert the hook into the back loop of next stitch pull up a loop yarn over and pull through both loops on the hook slip_stitch insert the hook into the back loop yarn over and pull through 6d= 6x double_crochet double_crochet yarn over hook insert in the front stitch of the same colour 2 row below yarn over and pull through the stitch yarn over pull through 2 loops on the hook yarn over hook and pull through the last 2 loops as the anchor single_crochet is at either side of every row you insert the hook through both loops and work a normal single_crochet at the end of the row i always do 2 knots by doing 2 chains then cut the yarn and tighten invisible join slip_stitch to the last stitch cut the yarn and pull the hook loose leaving approximately 10 inches thread the end into
